export_info.title: history-department-june-2012
export_info.author: matt.price@utoronto.ca
export_info.description: This site was created in part using the Custom Content Type Manager

people.label: People
people.description: People in the department.  Definition of content type managed by the Custom Content Type Manager

book.label: Books
book.description: Major faculty publications are listed below, by publication year. Works therefore may not be listed together with other books by the same author.

labels.not_found_in_trash: No course sections found in trash

coursesection.description: This is where you create/change real sections of courses that actually meet.
coursesection.label: Course Sections

labels.not_found_in_trash: No publications: articles found in trash

pub_article.description: For importatn artciles faculty members would like to highlight in their profiles.
pub_article.label: Books

labels.not_found_in_trash: No publications: other found in trash

pub_other.description: For important works other than books, articles, and book chapters that faculty members would like to highlight in their profiles.  This may include websites, documentaries, etc.
pub_other.label: Books

photo.label: Photo
photo.name: photo
photo.description: Add a picture of this person here

other_web_url.label: Other Web URL
other_web_url.name: other_web_url
other_web_url.description: The URL of a second blog or other web presence

academia.label: Academia.edu
academia.name: academia
academia.description: If you have an account iwth academia.edu, enter your user ID here.  This should be the last part of your academia.edu URL, coming after utoronto.academia.edu, and is usually your first and last name written in CamelCase.

publications.label: Selected Publications
publications.name: publications
publications.description:
Add your publications data here. Use basic html 
tags for italics ad other styling, e.g. <i> this will be italicized </i> and <b>this will be bold</b>

other_web_name.label: Other Web Name
other_web_name.name: other_web_name
other_web_name.description: A title for your other web page (e.g., "Home Page," or the name of a project, etc.

facebook.label: Facebook ID
facebook.name: facebook
facebook.description: If you have a professional facebook account, enter your ID here. It should be the lat part of your facebook URL. Do NOT use a personal account.

blog_name.label: Blog Name
blog_name.name: blog_name
blog_name.description: The Title of your blog, if you have one

blog_url.label: Blog Address
blog_url.name: blog_url
blog_url.description: Enter the URL of your blog or  other web page.

office_hours.label: Office Hours
office_hours.name: office_hours
office_hours.description: Add your fixed office hours here.

authors.label: Authors
authors.name: authors
authors.description: Add the full author field as you would like it to be displayed on the page, e.g. "John Edgar Smith, Lois Lane, and Clart Kent".

call_number.label: Library Call Number
call_number.name: call_number
call_number.description: Enter the call number under which this book is filed at the University of Toronto Library.

issn.label: ISBN
issn.name: issn
issn.description: The ISSN is a unique identifier for books which allows us to collect data about it from the Internet.  You can find it in the details section of the book listing on Amazon or the library catalog.

large_blurb.label: blurb
large_blurb.name: large_blurb
large_blurb.description: Enter the full text of a blurb for the book here.

belongs_to.label: Belongs To
belongs_to.name: belongs_to
belongs_to.description: Associate this item with another item in the database. E.g., to associate a book with a person, click here, type the person's last name in the search box, and select the appropriate post.

course_fullyear.label: All Year
course_fullyear.name: course_fullyear
course_fullyear.description: Check this box if course is offered as a full-year course.

course_semcode.label: Half or Year?
course_semcode.name: course_semcode
course_semcode.description: H1 for a half Course, Y1 for a full year course

course_jointwith.label: Joint With
course_jointwith.name: course_jointwith
course_jointwith.button_label: Click to choose a joint course

coursesection_parent.label: Parent Course
coursesection_parent.name: coursesection_parent
coursesection_parent.description: Choose the course of which you are making a section

coursesection_secnum.label: Section
coursesection_secnum.name: coursesection_secnum
coursesection_secnum.description: If there is a section number for this instance of the course, enter it here.

coursesection_furtherdesc.label: Further Description
coursesection_furtherdesc.name: coursesection_furtherdesc
coursesection_furtherdesc.description: If this is a section of a  "Topics" course, such as HIS389 or HIS495, enter a further description of the course here. Otherwise leave this field blank.

coursesection_subtitle.label: Additional Title
coursesection_subtitle.name: coursesection_subtitle
coursesection_subtitle.description: If this is a section of a "Topics" class, such as HIS389 or HIS495, enter the subtitle here. Otherwise please leave this field blank.

coursesection_alertnotice.label: Alert Notice
coursesection_alertnotice.name: coursesection_alertnotice
coursesection_alertnotice.description: Occasionally you may want to display a highlighted notification or alert -- for instance, when a course instructor is chosen late or a new section is added at the beginning of hte semester.  Type that notice here, and remove it after an appropriate length of time.

coursesection_daytime.label: Day and TIme
coursesection_daytime.name: coursesection_daytime
coursesection_daytime.description:
Write the day and time in timetable assion, e.g. 
T R 10
F 10-12
etc.

people_emeritus.label: Emeritus
people_emeritus.name: people_emeritus
people_emeritus.description: Check this box only if this person is emeritus.

coursesection_room.label: Location (room)
coursesection_room.name: coursesection_room
coursesection_room.description: Enter the room number for the section here, e.g. SS 2108, UC 257. Use the official building codes from the artsci website.

course_premodern.label: Fulfills pre-modern Requirement
course_premodern.name: course_premodern
course_premodern.description: Check this box if the course officially fills the pre-modern requirement for history degrees.

people_rank.label: Rank
people_rank.name: people_rank
people_rank.description: If this person is a faculty member, choose their rank here.

course_division.label: Division
course_division.name: course_division
course_division.description: Check all divisions that apply (in some cases, courses will not belong to any division)

people_onleave.label: On Leave
people_onleave.name: people_onleave
people_onleave.description: Check this box if the person is currently on leave.

people_advisors.label: Advisors
people_advisors.name: people_advisors
people_advisors.description: If you are a graduate student, add your advisors here.  Please keep this uptodate as the information will appear both on your profile page and your advisors'.

person_cv.label: CV
person_cv.name: person_cv
person_cv.description: If you have a pdf version of your CV, please feel free to upload it here.  Please note that it wil be your own responsibility to keep this document up to date i nthe future.

book_url.label: URL for this item
book_url.name: book_url
book_url.description: Enter a URL associated with this book -- this could be a page on the publisher's website, a link to library listings, a page on  commercial site such as amazon.com, or any other permanent link to the book.

pub_localcopy.label: Store a version
pub_localcopy.name: pub_localcopy
pub_localcopy.description:
If you would like to store a copy of this article directly on the departmental website, please add it using the upload button below.  Please note the following:
(1) there may be copyright restrictions on the article in question, even if you are the sole author (!). Please ensure that you own the copyright on the work in question -- often this can be as simple as uploading your own version of hte paper, rather than a journal's typeset final version.
(2) The best practice for sharing your work is to use the T-Space Open Access repositories (or another Open Access repository, like archive.org or google books). If you have already made your work available at one of these places, please leave this field blank and, instead, enter the URL of your article below.

pub_url.label: URL for this item
pub_url.name: pub_url
pub_url.description: Enter a URL associated with this publication .  The best practice is to link directly to content that is available to the general public, e.g. through your T-Space repository.  If you have not made the publication available through T-space or other Open Access publishing channels, and if you are bound by copyright agreements not to distribute your work directly, use this URL to link to the journal's page for your article.  But please bear in mind that many journals are protected by paywalls, so scholars without subscriptions may not be able to read your work.

pubabstract.label: Abstract
pubabstract.name: pubabstract
pubabstract.description: Please enter a summary of this publication here.

pubcitation.label: Citation Information
pubcitation.name: pubcitation
pubcitation.description: This website cannot provide detailed, sophisticated citation information in a manner flexible enough to accommodate a wide range of publicaiton types. We therefore leave it to the authors to enter this information by hand, in this field.  Please do so here.
